docs.snippet: Whether Prime Minister Abe will be able to pursue his ambition of overturning the clause that calls for the complete renunciation of war remains to be seen....
docs.lead_paragraph: Whether Prime Minister Abe will be able to pursue his ambition of overturning the clause that calls for the complete renunciation of war remains to be seen.
docs.abstract: Governing coalition of Prime Min Shinzo Abe gains two-thirds of seats in Japan's upper house of Parliament, move which enables them to revise 69-year-old Constitution that denounces war.

headline.main: Japan Vote Strengthens Shinzo Abe’s Goal to Change Constitution
headline.print_headline: Japan Vote Strengthens  Prime Minister’s Effort  to Change Constitution

byline.contributor: Makiko Inoue and Hisako Ueno contributed reporting.

docs.snippet: South Africa's telecoms regulator ordered the public broadcaster on Monday to reverse its decision to stop airing footage of violent protests, a policy which critics said amounted to censorship....
docs.lead_paragraph: South Africa's telecoms regulator ordered the public broadcaster on Monday to reverse its decision to stop airing footage of violent protests, a policy which critics said amounted to censorship.

headline.main: South African State TV Ordered to End Ban on Airing Protest Violence
headline.print_headline: South African State TV Ordered to End Ban on Airing Protest Violence

docs.snippet: Renewed fighting between opposing army forces has raised fears of a return to civil war in South Sudan, which over the weekend marked its fifth anniversary of independence while panicked residents hid inside their homes....

headline.main: A Look at South Sudan, a Young Country Divided by Civil War
headline.print_headline: A Look at South Sudan, a Young Country Divided by Civil War

docs.snippet: Congo's leading opposition candidate for president said Monday he was poisoned as part of a government plot to kill him, a dramatic claim almost certain to escalate tensions even further over upcoming elections in one of Africa's largest countries...
docs.lead_paragraph: Congo's leading opposition candidate for president said Monday he was poisoned as part of a government plot to kill him, a dramatic claim almost certain to escalate tensions even further over upcoming elections in one of Africa's largest countries.

headline.main: Congo Opposition Leader Says Government Tried to Kill Him
headline.print_headline: Congo Opposition Leader Says Government Tried to Kill Him
